exports.name: ChessBoardElement
exports.description: A custom element that renders an interactive chess board.

members.name: position
members.description:
The current position of the board, as a `PositionObject`. This property may
be set externally, but only to valid `PositionObject`s. The value is copied
before being applied to the board. Changes to the position object are not
reflected in th rendering.

To set the position using FEN, or a keyword like `'start'`, or to use
animations, use the `setPosition` method.

members.name: hideNotation
members.description: Whether to show the board notation.

members.name: showNotation
members.description:
Whether to show the board notation. This is always the inverse of
`hideNotation`, which reflects the `hide-notation` attribute.

members.name: orientation
members.description:
The orientation of the board. `'white'` for the white player at the bottom,
`'black'` for the black player at the bottom.

members.name: draggablePieces
members.description: If `true`, pieces on the board are draggable to other squares.

members.name: dropOffBoard
members.description:
If `'snapback'`, pieces dropped off the board will return to their original
square. If `'trash'`, pieces dropped off the board will be removed from the
board.

This property has no effect when `draggable` is `false`.

members.name: pieceTheme
members.description: A template string used to determine the source of piece images. If `pieceTheme` is a function the first argument is the piece code. The function should return an `` source.

members.name: moveSpeed
members.description:
Animation speed for when pieces move between squares or from spare pieces
to the board.

members.name: snapbackSpeed
members.description:
Animation speed for when pieces that were dropped outside the board return
to their original square.

members.name: snapSpeed
members.description: Animation speed for when pieces \"snap\" to a square when dropped.

members.name: trashSpeed
members.description: Animation speed for when pieces are removed.

members.name: appearSpeed
members.description:
Animation speed for when pieces appear on a square.

Note that the "appear" animation only occurs when `sparePieces` is `false`.

members.name: sparePieces
members.description:
If `true`, the board will have spare pieces that can be dropped onto the
board. If `sparePieces` is set to `true`, `draggablePieces` gets set to
`true` as well.

members.name: setPosition
members.description: Sets the position of the board.

parameters.name: useAnimation
parameters.description:
If `true`, animate to the new position. If `false`,
show the new position instantly.

members.name: fen
members.description: Returns the current position as a FEN string.

members.name: start
members.description: Sets the board to the start position.

parameters.name: useAnimation
parameters.description:
If `true`, animate to the new position. If `false`,
show the new position instantly.

members.name: clear
members.description:
Removes all the pieces on the board. If `useAnimation` is `false`, removes
pieces instantly.

This is shorthand for `setPosition({})`.

parameters.name: useAnimation
parameters.description:
If `true`, animate to the new position. If `false`,
show the new position instantly.

members.name: move
members.description:
Executes one or more moves on the board.

Moves are strings the form of "e2-e4", "f6-d5", etc., Pass `false` as an
argument to disable animation.

members.name: flip
members.description: Flip the orientation.

members.name: resize
members.description:
Recalculates board and square sizes based on the parent element and redraws
the board accordingly.

attributes.name: position
attributes.description:
The current position of the board, as a `PositionObject`. This property may
be set externally, but only to valid `PositionObject`s. The value is copied
before being applied to the board. Changes to the position object are not
reflected in th rendering.

To set the position using FEN, or a keyword like `'start'`, or to use
animations, use the `setPosition` method.

attributes.name: hide-notation
attributes.description: Whether to show the board notation.

Whether to show the board notation. This is always the inverse of
`hideNotation`, which reflects the `hide-notation` attribute.

attributes.name: orientation
attributes.description:
The orientation of the board. `'white'` for the white player at the bottom,
`'black'` for the black player at the bottom.

attributes.name: draggable-pieces
attributes.description: If `true`, pieces on the board are draggable to other squares.

attributes.name: drop-off-board
attributes.description:
If `'snapback'`, pieces dropped off the board will return to their original
square. If `'trash'`, pieces dropped off the board will be removed from the
board.

This property has no effect when `draggable` is `false`.

attributes.name: piece-theme
attributes.description: A template string used to determine the source of piece images. If `pieceTheme` is a function the first argument is the piece code. The function should return an `` source.

attributes.name: move-speed
attributes.description:
Animation speed for when pieces move between squares or from spare pieces
to the board.

attributes.name: snapback-speed
attributes.description:
Animation speed for when pieces that were dropped outside the board return
to their original square.

attributes.name: snap-speed
attributes.description: Animation speed for when pieces \"snap\" to a square when dropped.

attributes.name: trash-speed
attributes.description: Animation speed for when pieces are removed.

attributes.name: appear-speed
attributes.description:
Animation speed for when pieces appear on a square.

Note that the "appear" animation only occurs when `sparePieces` is `false`.

attributes.name: spare-pieces
attributes.description:
If `true`, the board will have spare pieces that can be dropped onto the
board. If `sparePieces` is set to `true`, `draggablePieces` gets set to
`true` as well.

events.name: mouseover-square
events.description:
Fired when the cursor is over a square
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `square`: the square that was entered
* `piece`: the piece on that square (or `false` if there is no piece)
* `position`: the current position
* `orientation`: the current orientation.

Note that `mouseover-square` will *not* fire during piece drag and drop.
Use `drag-move` instead.

events.name: mouseout-square
events.description:
Fired when the cursor exits a square
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
`square`: the square that was left
`piece`: the piece on that square (or `false` if there is no piece)
`position`: the current position
`orientation`: the current orientation.

Note that `mouseout-square` will *not* fire during piece drag and drop.
Use `drag-move` instead.

events.name: snapback-end
events.description:
Fired when the snapback animation is complete when
pieces are dropped off the board.
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `piece`: the dragged piece
* `square`: the square the piece returned to
* `position`: the current position
* `orientation`: the current orientation.

events.name: snap-end
events.description:
Fired when a piece completes a snap animation
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `source`: the source of the dragged piece
* `square`: the target of the dragged piece
* `piece`: the dragged piece

events.name: drag-start
events.description:
Fired when a piece is picked up
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `source`: the source of the piece
* `piece`: the piece
* `position`: the current position on the board
* `orientation`: the current orientation.

The drag action is prevented if the listener calls `event.preventDefault()`.

events.name: drag-move
events.description:
Fired when a user-initiated drag moves
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `newLocation`: the new location of the piece
* `oldLocation`: the old location of the piece
* `source`: the source of the dragged piece
* `piece`: the piece
* `position`: the current position on the board
* `orientation`: the current orientation.

events.name: drop
events.description:
Fired when a user-initiated drag ends
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `source`: the source of the dragged piece
* `target`: the target of the dragged piece
* `piece`: the piece
* `newPosition`: the new position once the piece drops
* `oldPosition`: the old position before the piece was picked up
* `orientation`: the current orientation.
* `setAction(action)`: a function to call to change the default action.
 If `'snapback'` is passed to `setAction`, the piece will return to it's source square.
 If `'trash'` is passed to `setAction`, the piece will be removed.

events.name: move-end
events.description:
Fired when a piece move completes
The event's `detail` object has the following properties:
* `oldPosition`: the old position
* `newPosition`: the new position

events.name: change
events.description:
Fired when the board position changes
The event's `detail` property has two properties:
* `value`: the new position
* `oldValue`: the old position

**Warning**: do *not* call any position-changing methods in your event
listener or you may cause an infinite loop. Position-changing methods
are: `clear()`, `move()`, `position()`, and `start()`.

events.name: error
events.description: Fired in the case of invalid attributes.

cssProperties.name: --light-color
cssProperties.description: The background for white squares and text color for black squares

cssProperties.name: --dark-color
cssProperties.description: The background for black squares and text color for white squares
